title: Who makes copyright free music? Do they get a worse deal for it being copyright free? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically, only the U.S government. Such as the National Marine Marching Band. In the U.S. all music is automatically protected by copyright. You can’t deliberately make “copyright free” music. Or any kind of content. You can let people use it for free, but that’s still a use license, created by your right as copyright owner. Obviously they are not getting a “good deal” since they are offering it for free.

Really good composers and music artists make royalty-free music. Such music is not copyright free. They do own the copyrights, but they allow others to license the music for a set price, so that continuous royalties do not have to be paid. They like making money and like having their music used by others.
